paper_abstract: We present the first algorithm for one-pass instantaneous coding which, given l > 0 and a string S of length m over an alphabet of size n, is guaranteed to encode S using at most (H + 1 + (1/(2l - 1)ln2)m + O(n log m) bits (H denotes the Oth-order empirical entropy of S), a proportional length of time, and no codewords longer than log n + f + 1 bits.
